message:
hello geeks,
anyone using te data's router ZTE ZXHN 108n v2.5 
there is a vulnerability if you tried to telnet your router ip (192.168.1.1) it will ask you for a password only and it is admin you can't change it you may change your http login password from the control panel but you can't get change your telnet password you can do everything + some things that you can't do if you logined from your browser (http) like knowing your PPP password and your wifi passowrd 
when anyone trie to connect to your router remotly using the public ip address he won't be able to do anything but if someone connected to your network he will be able to do everything 
pay attention
Good luck

data.message: Try port forwarding the telnet default port
